intro: Siapaea, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a rare and elusive plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, white, and translucent flowers that appear to float in the air, giving it a ghostly appearance. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other members of the carrot family. Due to its rarity and unique appearance, Siapaea is often studied for its ecological and botanical significance.
